ray.rage.scene

Interface Camera

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, SceneObject, Visible
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericCamera

    public interface Camera
extends SceneObject
    A camera is viewpoint from which the scene will be rendered.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Camera.Frustum
      A frustum represents a pyramid, capped at the near and far end, which is used to represent either a visible area or a projection area.
      static interface  Camera.Listener
      Listener interface to notify clients of camera events.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Adds a listener to this camera.

    • Method Detail

      • getFrustum

        Camera.Frustum getFrustum()
        Gets the frustum in use by this camera.
        Returns:
        The frustum.

      • renderScene

        void renderScene()
        Causes the scene-manager to render the scene from this camera's perspective.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the viewport has not been set.

      • notifyViewport

        void notifyViewport(Viewport vp)
        Notifies this camera that a viewport is using it.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Parameters:
        vp - The viewport using this camera.

      • getViewport

        Viewport getViewport()
        Gets the viewport using this camera.
        Returns:
        The viewport if this camera is being used. Otherwise null.

      • addListener

        void addListener(Camera.Listener listener)
        Adds a listener to this camera.
        Parameters:
        listener - The Camera.Listener being added.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(Camera.Listener listener)
        Removes the specified listener from this camera.
        Parameters:
        listener - The Camera.Listener to remove.

      • setFd

        void setFd(Vector3f v)
        Sets the forward (N) vector for this camera.
        Parameters:
        v - A Vector3f specifying the desired forward camera axis. Note that the three vectors U, V, N must be orthogonal.

      • setRt

        void setRt(Vector3f v)
        Sets the sideways/right (U) vector for this camera.
        Parameters:
        v - A Vector3f specifying the desired sideways (right) camera axis. Note that the three vectors U, V, N must be orthogonal.

      • setUp

        void setUp(Vector3f v)
        Sets the vertical/up (V) vector for this camera.
        Parameters:
        v - A Vector3f specifying the desired vertical camera axis. Note that the three vectors U, V, N must be orthogonal.

      • setPo

        void setPo(Vector3f v)
        Sets the position/location of this camera.
        Parameters:
        v - A Vector3f specifying the desired camera location.

      • setMode

        void setMode(char m)
        Sets the current operating mode of this camera.
        Parameters:
        m - A char specifying the desired camera mode. "c" means that the view matrix will be generated from camera axes U,V,N. "r" means that the view matrix will be generated from the node orientation. Mode "r" is generally used when attaching the camera to a game object.

      • getFd

        Vector3f getFd()
        Gets the current forward vector N for this camera.

      • getRt

        Vector3f getRt()
        Gets the current sideways (right) vector U for this camera.

      • getUp

        Vector3f getUp()
        Gets the current vertical (up) vector V for this camera.

      • getPo

        Vector3f getPo()
        Gets the current position/location of this camera.

      • getMode

        char getMode()
        Gets the current operating mode for this camera. Returns a char specifying the current camera mode. "c" means that the view matrix will be generated from camera axes U,V,N. "r" means that the view matrix will be generated from the node orientation. Mode "r" is generally used when attaching the camera to a game object.
